pages.text: You might not yet have a quern, but that doesn't mean you can't enjoy some lovely grain products!

Some grains can be hammered on a $(l:tfc:getting_started/primitive_anvils)Primitive Anvil$() into $(thing)Crushed Grains$(). These yield some grain nutrients themselves, but are best processed further before eaten.
One way to further process crushed grains is to pound them, also on an Anvil, into $(thing)Coarse Flour$().
Maize and Rice Grains are already in small pieces, so they can be pounded directly into Coarse Flour.
Coarse Flour can be crafted into $(l:tfc:mechanics/bread)dough$(), just as regular flour can, but this only yields one dough for every two flour, rather than two for every one flour.
A more efficient option is porridge, which is made by boiling 3-5 crushed grains and 0-2 fruit in a water pot.
All Crushed Grain and Coarse Flour items can also be ground in the quern to produce regular flour.
